question: Differences between javascript and nodejs
answer: Javascript is a client-side scripting language whereas Nodejs is a server-side scripting language. Javascript runs on the browser but Nodejs helps javascript to run outside of the browser. Javascript is capable to use HTML and play with dom but nodejs isn't capable to use any HTML tags.

question: Differences between sql and nosql databases.
answer: Where SQL databases are vertically scalable, NoSQL databases are horizontally scalable. SQL databases are table-based whereas NoSQL databases are key-value pairs/ document-based/ graph, or wide-column stores. SQL databases have fixed schema which is rigid while NoSQL databases have dynamic schema which is flexible.
